content.question: Which of the following best explains how irrigated commercial agriculture in arid environments creates both environmental opportunities and challenges?

choices.label: Deforestation increases production but can damage natural habitats.
Irrigation increases production but potentially depletes water resources.
Desertification decreases available farmland and decreases production.
Terracing hillsides increases production but reduces water quality.
Shifting cultivation increases available farmland but damages habitats.

content.answer: Irrigation increases production but potentially depletes water resources.
